query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Io dico, seguitando, ch’assai prima 2 che noi fossimo al piè de l’alta torre, 3 li occhi nostri n’andar suso a la cima
query.error: **English:** 1 I say, continuing, that long before 2 we were at the foot of the high tower, 3 our eyes went up to the top
query.result: 1 Me a lever, ow kul, kyns o bell 2 genesen ni dheler an tŵr ughel, 3 an dhewlyn ni a wrug sevel dhe benn

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 per due fiammette che i vedemmo porre, 5 e un’altra da lungi render cenno, 6 tanto ch’a pena il potea l’occhio tòrre.
query.error: **English:** 4 because of two flames that we saw placed there, 5 and another from afar giving a signal, 6 so that the eye could barely make it out.
query.result: 4 rag dhew flamm a weles ni settya, 5 hag unn arall a bell ow ros henna, 6 kepar dell o an lagha a alla.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 E io mi volsi al mar di tutto ’l senno; 8 dissi: «Questo che dice? e che risponde 9 quell’ altro foco? e chi son quei che ’l fenno?».
query.error: **English:** 7 And I turned to the sea of all wisdom; 8 I said: “What does this one say? and what does 9 that other fire answer? and who are those who made them?”.
query.result: 7 Ha my a droes dhe’n mor a oll an fur, 8 ow leveris: “Pyth yw henna a lever? ha pyth 9 yw henna tan arall owth atteb? ha pwy yw henna a wrug?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Ed elli a me: «Su per le sucide onde 11 già scorgere puoi quello che s’aspetta, 12 se ’l fummo del pantan nol ti nasconde».
query.error: **English:** 10 And he to me: “Up over the suicidal waves 11 you can already make out that which is awaited, 12 if the smoke of the marsh does not hide it from you”.
query.result: 10 Ha henna dhymm: “Wartha dhe’n tonnow marow 11 a wra gena gweles henna a wra gorthys, 12 mar nascondi an moyth an morva dhymm dhytho”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Corda non pinse mai da sé saetta 14 che sì corresse via per l’aere snella, 15 com’ io vidi una nave piccioletta
query.error: **English:** 13 Never did a cord think of an arrow for itself 14 that ran so swiftly through the air, 15 as I saw a tiny boat
query.result: 13 Nag yth poes korden byth a wrug saeth dhodho, 14 a rennje kemmys vyth dre’n ayr, 15 dell vyth gweles kaven vyghan

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 venir per l’acqua verso noi in quella, 17 sotto ’l governo d’un sol galeoto, 18 che gridava: «Or se’ giunta, anima fella!».
query.error: **English:** 16 coming towards us across the water, 17 under the guidance of a single boatman, 18 who shouted: “Now you have arrived, wicked soul!”.
query.result: 16 ow tos dhe’n dowr dhe’n ni, 17 danvonn unn morvoryon, 18 ow leveris: “Wrug os hwegh, eneval ankow!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 «Flegïàs, Flegïàs, tu gridi a vòto», 20 disse lo mio segnore, «a questa volta: 21 più non ci avrai che sol passando il loto».
query.error: **English:** 19 "Phlegyas, Phlegyas, you cry out in vain," 20 said my lord, "this time: 21 you will have no more than just passing over the marsh."
query.result: 19 "Flegïàs, Flegïàs, te a wragh yn omdhre," 20 a leveris ow arluth, "an termyn ma: 21 nyns yw genes ganses tremena an loth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Qual è colui che grande inganno ascolta 23 che li sia fatto, e poi se ne rammarca, 24 fecesi Flegïàs ne l’ira accolta.
query.error: **English:** 22 Such is he who listens to a great deception 23 that is done to him, and then regrets it, 24 Phlegyas became in the gathered wrath.
query.result: 22 Pyth yw henna neb a glew an golon bras 23 a wra gwres dhe'n, ha wosa henna moscowetha, 24 Flegïàs a wrug yn an growtghas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Lo duca mio discese ne la barca, 26 e poi mi fece intrare appresso lui; 27 e sol quand’ io fui dentro parve carca.
query.error: **English:** 25 My leader descended into the boat, 26 and then made me enter after him; 27 and only when I was inside did it seem laden.
query.result: 25 An myghtern vy a dhyskynnas yn an gwib, 26 ha wosa henna ev a wrug vy mos dha'n, 27 ha pan oen oen oen vy yn mes ev a dhiskwedhas gorrys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Tosto che ’l duca e io nel legno fui, 29 segando se ne va l’antica prora 30 de l’acqua più che non suol con altrui.
query.error: **English:** 28 As soon as the leader and I were in the boat, 29 the ancient prow cuts through 30 the water more than it usually does with others.
query.result: 28 Kyns ages an myghtern ha vy yn an gwib, 29 an prora koth a way yn segel, 30 an dowr moy ages ev a wra gans tus erel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Mentre noi corravam la morta gora, 32 dinanzi mi si fece un pien di fango, 33 e disse: «Chi se’ tu che vieni anzi ora?».
query.error: **English:** 31 While we were running along the dead shore, 32 in front of me there appeared one full of mud, 33 and said: "Who are you that come before your time?".
query.result: 31 Pan oen oen oen nyn gorras an menydh marow, 32 kyns vy ev a dheuth dhe'm rag, leun a fank, 33 ha leverel: "Neb es ty a dheu kyns an eur?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E io a lui: «S’i’ vegno, non rimango; 35 ma tu chi se’, che sì se’ fatto brutto?». 36 Rispuose: «Vedi che son un che piango».
query.error: **English:** 34 And I to him: "If I come, I do not remain; 35 but who are you, who have become so ugly?". 36 He answered: "See that I am one who weeps".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 E io a lui: «Con piangere e con lutto, 38 spirito maladetto, ti rimani; 39 ch’i’ ti conosco, ancor sie lordo tutto».
query.error: **English:** 37 And I to him: "With weeping and with mourning, 38 cursed spirit, may you remain; 39 for I know you, even though you are all filthy".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Allor distese al legno ambo le mani; 41 per che ’l maestro accorto lo sospinse, 42 dicendo: «Via costà con li altri cani!».
query.error: **English:** 40 Then he stretched both his hands to the wood; 41 whereupon the wise master pushed him away, 42 saying: "Away with you there with the other dogs!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 43 Then he put his arms around my neck; 44 he kissed my face and said: "Soul disdainful, 45 blessed is she who conceived you!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Quei fu al mondo persona orgogliosa; 47 bontà non è che sua memoria fregi: 48 così s’è l’ombra sua qui furïosa.
query.error: **English:** 46 That man was a proud person in the world; 47 there is no goodness that adorns his memory: 48 that is why his shade is so furious here.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Quanti si tegnon or là sù gran regi 50 che qui staranno come porci in brago, 51 di sé lasciando orribili dispregi!».
query.error: **English:** 49 How many who now hold themselves as great kings up there 50 will wallow here like swine in the mire, 51 leaving behind them horrible contempt!
query.result: 49 Pyth yw an re beu yn reow meur y’n uhella 50 a vydh yma avel hwch yn brago, 51 ow tos owth anedha anedrek orth!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 E io: «Maestro, molto sarei vago 53 di vederlo attuffare in questa broda 54 prima che noi uscissimo del lago».
query.error: **English:** 52 And I: "Master, I would be very keen 53 to see him plunged into this broth 54 before we leave the lake".
query.result: 52 Ha my: "Mestr, meur a vynnaf 53 gweles ev tuffyes yn an broth ma 54 kyns henna ni a-dhyllo an lyn".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Ed elli a me: «Avante che la proda 56 ti si lasci veder, tu sarai sazio: 57 di tal disïo convien che tu goda».
query.error: **English:** 55 And he to me: "Before the shore 56 lets itself be seen by you, you will be satisfied: 57 with such desire it is fitting that you feast".
query.result: 55 Ha'y th'ytho vy: "A-rag na'n fordh 56 ty sy leskyth gweles, ty vyth seth: 57 gans an dysyr na wra vyth lowen".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Dopo ciò poco vid’ io quello strazio 59 far di costui a le fangose genti, 60 che Dio ancor ne lodo e ne ringrazio.
query.error: **English:** 58 After that, I soon saw that wretch 59 being tortured by the muddy people, 60 for which I still praise and thank God.
query.result: 58 Wosa henna vyth gweles vy an poen 59 gwres ganso dhe'n bobel fanken, 60 rag henna vyth molla ha golla Duw.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:

query.result: 67 An mester da a leveris: "Wella, fy mab, 68 yma yw an cita a henwir Dite, 69 gans y chyfasedh trues, gans an golon bras."

91 Sol si ritorni per la folle strada: 92 pruovi, se sa; ché tu qui rimarrai, 93 che li ha’ iscorta sì buia contrada».

94 Pensa, lettor, se io mi sconfortai 95 nel suon de le parole maladette, 96 ché non credetti ritornarci mai.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 E quel segnor che lì m’avea menato, 104 mi disse: «Non temer; ché ’l nostro passo 105 non ci può tòrre alcun: da tal n’è dato.
query.error: **English:** 103 And that lord who had led me there, 104 said to me: "Do not fear; for our passage 105 cannot be taken from us by anyone: it is granted by such a one."
query.result: 103 Ha'gan argluydh a'm gorra hwathsa, 104 a leveris dhym: "Na vynnaf; rag an fordh 105 nyns yw possybyl dhe'n kemer gans neb: rag y feu res dhe'n keth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Ma qui m’attendi, e lo spirito lasso 107 conforta e ciba di speranza buona, 108 ch’i’ non ti lascerò nel mondo basso».
query.error: **English:** 106 But here wait for me, and comfort and nourish 107 my weary spirit with good hope, 108 for I will not leave you in the world below."
query.result: 106 Mes yma kavoel, ha'gas an spyrys dalleth 107 kusul ha boos ha'gas goon spyrans, 108 rag nyns gwell vy yn bys isel."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Così sen va, e quivi m’abbandona 110 lo dolce padre, e io rimagno in forse, 111 che sì e no nel capo mi tenciona.
query.error: **English:** 109 Thus he departs, and here he leaves me, 110 my sweet father, and I remain in doubt, 111 for yes and no contend in my head.
query.result: 109 Vel dh'ytholl, ha'gas yma'm gwell yn unnik, 110 an tas dhe, ha my a wra yn ansoedh, 111 rag ie ha nag a wra yn stryf yn'n ben.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Udir non potti quello ch’a lor porse; 113 ma ei non stette là con essi guari, 114 che ciascun dentro a pruova si ricorse.
query.error: **English:** 112 I could not hear what he said to them; 113 but I did not stay there with them long, 114 for each of them ran back inside, vying with the others.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Chiuser le porte que’ nostri avversari 116 nel petto al mio segnor, che fuor rimase 117 e rivolsesi a me con passi rari.
query.error: **English:** 115 Our adversaries shut the gates 116 in my lord's chest, so that he remained outside, 117 and he turned to me with slow steps.
query.result: 115 Anedha a dhegys an fordhow nyns gwithyas 116 yn krev an arluydh vy, a veu dheworto, 117 ha'gas a droos dhymm orth vy gans passys araf.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Li occhi a la terra e le ciglia avea rase 119 d’ogne baldanza, e dicea ne’ sospiri: 120 «Chi m’ha negate le dolenti case!».
query.error: **English:** 118 His eyes were fixed on the ground and his eyelashes were shorn 119 of all boldness, and he said with sighs: 120 “Who has denied me the sorrowful houses!”.
query.result: 118 An lagha dhe'n dor ha'n kegil o veu rase 119 d’ogne baldanza, ha dyw ne'n sospiri: 120 “Piw m’ha negate an dolenti case!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 E a me disse: «Tu, perch’ io m’adiri, 122 non sbigottir, ch’io vincerò la prova, 123 qual ch’a la difension dentro s’aggiri.
query.error: **English:** 121 And to me he said: "You, why are you afraid, 122 do not be dismayed, for I will conquer the trial, 123 whoever goes about inside for the defense.
query.result: 121 Ha dhomm: "Ty, perag om m'edhiri, 122 na wra vydh, rag y'm gwynnons an preuf, 123 pywhag a wra a-dro dhe'n difens."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Questa lor tracotanza non è nova; 125 ché già l’usaro a men segreta porta, 126 la qual sanza serrame ancor si trova.
query.error: **English:** 124 This arrogance of theirs is not new; 125 for they already used it on me at a secret gate, 126 which is still there, unlocked.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Sovr’ essa vedestù la scritta morta: 128 e già di qua da lei discende l’erta, 129 passando per li cerchi sanza scorta,
query.error: **English:** 127 Above it you saw the dead inscription: 128 and now beyond it the steep path descends, 129 passing through the circles without a guide,
query.result: 127 Uwch ythoma’th eus tys a’th welas an skrif marow: 128 ha nans yw an erta ow tiskenn, 129 ow tremena dre’n kehylow heb scor.

130 tal che per lui ne fia la terra aperta».
